adjective.description: Having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
examples: most workers were indifferent to foreign affairs
they all seemed indifferent rather than angry
attempts to distinguish between good, bad, and indifferent work

adjective.description: Neutral in respect of some specified physical property.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense having no partiality for or against): via Old French from Latin indifferent- not making any difference, from in- not + different- differing (see different).
